sen.j: 松平 資承（まつだいら すけつぐ）は、丹後国宮津藩の第3代藩主。
sen.e: Suketsugu MATSUDAIRA was the third lord of the Miyazu domain, Tango Province.
Suketsugu MATSUDAIRA was the third lord of the Miyazu Domain, Tango Province.
sen.cmt: domainの頭文字を大文字に変更
sen.e: Suketsugu MATSUDAIRA was the third lord of the Miyazu Domain, Tango Province.
He was the sixth generation of the Honjo Matsudaira family.
He was the sixth generation of the Honjo Matsudaira family.
He was the sixth generation of the Honjo Matsudaira family.

sen.j: 寛延2年（1749年）10月29日、上総国大多喜藩の第3代藩主・松平正温の三男として江戸で生まれる。
sen.e: He was born as the third son of Masaharu MATSUDAIRA, the third lord of Okita Domain, Kazusa Province on December 8, 1749.
On December 8, 1749, he was born in Edo as the third son of Masaharu MATSUDAIRA, the third lord of the Okita Domain, Kazusa Province.
sen.cmt: on December 8, 1749の位置を文頭に移動、「江戸で」→訳漏れのため訳出、the Okita Domainとしました。
sen.e: On December 8, 1749, he was born in Edo as the third son of Masaharu MATSUDAIRA, the third lord of the Okita Domain, Kazusa Province.

sen.j: 明和2年（1765年）に宮津藩の第2代藩主・松平資尹が死去したため、その養子として家督を継いで第3代藩主となる。
sen.e: Since Suketada MATSUDAIRA, the second lord of the Miyazu domain, died in 1765, he succeeded to the family head and became the third lord of domain as Suketada's adopted child.
Since Suketada MATSUDAIRA, the second lord of the Miyazu Domain, died in 1765, he succeeded to the family head and became the third lord of the Domain as Suketada's adopted child.
sen.cmt: domainの頭文字を大文字に変更、the third lord of domain→the third lord of the Domainとし、余分なスペース消去
sen.e: Since Suketada MATSUDAIRA, the second lord of the Miyazu Domain, died in 1765, he succeeded to the family head and became the third lord of the Domain as Suketada's adopted child.

sen.j: 安永5年（1776年）1月に奏者番に任じられ、天明4年（1784年）4月26日に寺社奉行に任じられて天明6年（1786年）11月2日まで務めている。
sen.e: He was appointed to sojaban (an official in charge of the ceremonies) in February, 1776 and jisha-bugyo (magistrate of temples and shrines) on June 13, 1784 and served until December 22, 1786.
He was appointed to sojaban (an official in charge of the ceremonies) in February, 1776 and jisha-bugyo (magistrate of temples and shrines) on June 13, 1784 and served until December 22, 1786.
He was appointed to sojaban (an official in charge of the ceremonies) in February, 1776 and jisha-bugyo (magistrate of temples and shrines) on June 13, 1784 and served until December 22, 1786.

sen.j: 藩政においては、天明の大飢饉で大被害を受けて米価が異常高騰し、餓死者が多数出て、古記録には「言語に尽し難き困窮の年柄」とある。
sen.e: For domain duties, rice price rose exceptionally due to the heavy damage by the Tenmei Famine, many people died from starvation, and it was described as 'it was the indescribable year of strained circumstances' in the old record.

For domain duties, rice price rose exceptionally due to the heavy damage by the Tenmei Famine, many people died from starvation, and it was described as 'it was the indescribable year of strained circumstances' in the old record.

For domain duties, rice price rose exceptionally due to the heavy damage by the Tenmei Famine, many people died from starvation, and it was described as 'it was the indescribable year of strained circumstances' in the old record.

sen.j: 寛政7年（1795年）11月17日、家督を次男の宗允に譲って隠居する。
sen.e: He ceded the family head position to his second son Munetada on December 27, 1795.
He ceded the family head position to his second son Munetada on December 27, 1795.
He ceded the family head position to his second son Munetada on December 27, 1795.

sen.j: 寛政12年（1800年）8月18日に江戸で死去。
sen.e: He died in Edo on October 6, 1800.
He died in Edo on October 6, 1800.
He died in Edo on October 6, 1800.
He was 52 years old.
He was 52 years old.
He was 52 years old.
